New Records: Mali reached the quarter-finals of the AFCON for the first time since 2013
Lassine Sinayoko scored his third goal at the AFCON 2024
Key Match Events: Edmond Tapsoba scored an own goal in the first half
Lassine Sinayoko doubled Mali's lead just after halftime
Bertrand Traore converted a penalty to reduce Burkina Faso's deficit
Pre-Game Insights: Mali made six changes from their previous lineup, including a new midfield setup
Burkina Faso made four changes from their previous match, with Bertrand Traore as captain
Post-Match Reflections: Mali's coach praised the team's resilience and effort
The victory is a significant milestone but there is still work to be done as they prepare for the semi-finals against Ivory Coast
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in 36Â°C heat
Mali scored the second fastest goal in the tournament, taking 133 seconds
The match was watched by CAF president Patrice Motsepe
